moves.1. f4: Hi everyone. I was challenged to this game by one of my good friends (i played black). His rating was 1175 when we started, and I was at 1492. He tried my opening as white, and i thought i would respond with....
moves.1... Nc6: Nc6. I didn't really care for moving any of the center pawns just yet.
moves.2. e3 d5 3. d4: I don't like this move, and it's obvious why. White does control e5, but his white squares are weak and he creates a backward pawn on e3. For those of you who don't know what a backward pawn is, it's a pawn that cannot be guarded by another pawn. Thus, he has to commit one of his pieces to defending it if it gets attacked.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Nf3 Bf5: Development....wanting to get the bishop out before I close the diagonal off.
moves.5. Nc3 e6 6. h3: Don't understand the point of this move... maybe to play g4 next
moves.6... Bb4: As you can see now I have all minor pieces developed with no real weaknesses.
moves.7. Bd2 Ne4 8. a3: Not a good move either. Reason for that is now I can play Bxc3 and after Bxc3, I have Nxc3.
moves.8... Bxc3 9. Bxc3 Nxc3: Now he must take with the b pawn. You generally don't want doubled pawns because they are hard to defend.
moves.10. bxc3 Be4 11. c4: Good move, trying to get rid of the double pawn.
moves.12... Qe7 13. c4 Rad8: Playing to blast open the middle. I want to do this because I have a more solid position.
moves.14. Ne5 Nxe5: Don't want that knight to do anything and my knight on c6 wasn't doing much.
moves.15. fxe5 f6: Again playing to open up the center. But I saw this and I wanted to open up the f-file for my rook.
moves.16. Bd3: This doesn't do much, he should have castled or done something to keep it closed.
moves.18... Rf2+: Unfortunately for him, another annoying check.
moves.19. Kc3 exd4+ 20. Qxd4 Qxe4 21. Qxe4: He had to do this because I had Qc2 and that would be very inconvenient for him. Also, his g pawn is under alot of pressure.
moves.21... dxe4 22. g4: Getting the pawn out of harm's way....
moves.22... a5: I played this because rook d3 is checkmate. He really has only 2 choices, either to play King b3 or to get a rook on the d-file. But for now I am hoping he doesn't see it.
moves.23... Rd3#: So overall this game goes to show that position is very important. Hopefully you were able to take something from this.
